alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 6:27PM CST until January 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel for Some Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow continues this evening with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Grant County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
